verses.verse: And Paul,<WG3972> looking<WG816> intently<WG816> at the Council,<WG4892> said,<WG3004> "Brethren,<WG435> <WG80> I have lived<WG4176> my life<WG4176> with a perfectly<WG3956> good<WG18> conscience<WG4893> before God<WG2316> up to this<WG3778> day.<WG2250>"
And the high<WG749> priest<WG749> Ananias<WG367> commanded<WG2004> those<WG3588> standing<WG3936> beside<WG3936> him to strike<WG5180> him on the mouth.<WG4750>

Then<WG5119> Paul<WG3972> said<WG3004> to him, "God<WG2316> is going<WG3195> to strike<WG5180> you, you whitewashed<WG2867> wall!<WG5109> And do you sit<WG2521> to try<WG2919> me according<WG2596> to the Law,<WG3551> and in violation<WG3891> of the Law<WG3891> order<WG2753> me to be struck<WG5180>?"
But the bystanders<WG3936> said,<WG3004> "Do you revile<WG3058> God's high<WG749> priest<WG749>?"

And Paul<WG3972> said,<WG5346> "I was not aware,<WG3609> brethren,<WG80> that he was high<WG749> priest;<WG749> for it is written,<WG1125> 'You shall not speak<WG3004> evil<WG2560> of a ruler<WG758> of your people.<WG2992>'"

But perceiving<WG1097> that one<WG1520> part<WG3313> were Sadducees<WG4523> and the other<WG2087> Pharisees,<WG5330> Paul<WG3972> [began] crying<WG2896> out in the Council,<WG4892> "Brethren,<WG435> <WG80> I am<WG1510> a Pharisee,<WG5330> a son<WG5207> of Pharisees;<WG5330> I am on trial<WG2919> for the hope<WG1680> and resurrection<WG386> of the dead!<WG3498>"
And as he said<WG2980> this,<WG3778> there arose<WG1096> a dissension<WG4714> between the Pharisees<WG5330> and Sadducees;<WG4523> and the assembly<WG4128> was divided.<WG4977>

For the Sadducees<WG4523> say<WG3004> that there is no<WG3361> resurrection,<WG386> nor<WG3383> an angel,<WG32> nor<WG3383> a spirit;<WG4151> but the Pharisees<WG5330> acknowledge<WG3670> them all.<WG297>

And there arose<WG1096> a great<WG3173> uproar;<WG2906> and some<WG5100> of the scribes<WG1122> of the Pharisaic<WG5330> party<WG3313> stood<WG450> up and [began] to argue<WG1264> heatedly,<WG1264> saying,<WG3004> "We find<WG2147> nothing<WG3762> wrong<WG2556> with this<WG3778> man;<WG444> suppose<WG1487> <WG1161> a spirit<WG4151> or<WG2228> an angel<WG32> has spoken<WG2980> to him?"

And as a great<WG4183> dissension<WG4714> was developing,<WG1096> the commander<WG5506> was afraid<WG5399> Paul<WG3972> would be torn<WG1288> to pieces<WG1288> by them and ordered<WG2753> the troops<WG4753> to go<WG2597> down<WG2597> and take<WG726> him away<WG726> from them by force,<WG726> and bring<WG71> him into the barracks.<WG3925>

But on the night<WG3571> [immediately] following,<WG7075> the Lord<WG2962> stood<WG2186> at his side and said,<WG3004> "Take<WG2293> courage;<WG2293> for as you have solemnly<WG1263> witnessed<WG1263> to My cause<WG3588> <WG4012> at Jerusalem,<WG2419> so<WG3779> you must<WG1163> witness<WG3140> at Rome<WG4516> also<WG2532>."

And when it was day,<WG2250> the Jews<WG2453> formed<WG4160> a conspiracy<WG4160> and bound<WG332> themselves<WG1438> under<WG332> an oath,<WG332> saying<WG3004> that they would neither<WG3383> eat<WG2068> nor<WG3383> drink<WG4095> until<WG2193> they had killed<WG615> Paul.<WG3972>
And there were more<WG4183> than forty<WG5065> who formed<WG4160> this<WG3778> plot.<WG4945>

And they came<WG4334> to the chief<WG749> priests<WG749> and the elders,<WG4245> and said,<WG3004> "We have bound<WG332> ourselves<WG1438> under<WG332> a solemn<WG331> oath<WG332> to taste<WG1089> nothing<WG3367> until<WG2193> we have killed<WG615> Paul.<WG3972>

"Now,<WG3568> therefore,<WG3767> you and the Council<WG4892> notify<WG1718> the commander<WG5506> to bring<WG2609> him down<WG2609> to you, as though<WG5613> you were going<WG3195> to determine<WG1231> his case<WG3588> <WG4012> by a more<WG199> thorough<WG199> investigation;<WG199> and we for our part are ready<WG2092> to slay<WG337> him before<WG4253> he comes<WG1448> near<WG1448> [the place.]"
But the son<WG5207> of Paul<WG3972>'s sister<WG79> heard<WG191> of their ambush,<WG1747> and he came<WG3854> and entered<WG1525> the barracks<WG3925> and told<WG518> Paul.

And Paul<WG3972> called<WG4341> one<WG1520> of the centurions<WG1543> to him and said,<WG5346> "Lead<WG520> this<WG3778> young<WG3494> man<WG3494> to the commander,<WG5506> for he has<WG2192> something<WG5100> to report<WG518> to him."

So<WG3767> he took<WG3880> him and led<WG71> him to the commander<WG5506> and said,<WG5346> "Paul<WG3972> the prisoner<WG1198> called<WG4341> me to him and asked<WG2065> me to lead<WG71> this<WG3778> young<WG3495> man<WG3495> to you since he has<WG2192> something<WG5100> to tell<WG2980> you."

And the commander<WG5506> took<WG1949> him by the hand<WG5495> and stepping<WG402> aside,<WG402> [began] to inquire<WG4441> of him privately,<WG2596> <WG2398> "What<WG5101> is it that you have<WG2192> to report<WG518> to me?"

And he said,<WG3004> "The Jews<WG2453> have agreed<WG4934> to ask<WG2065> you to bring<WG2609> Paul<WG3972> down<WG2609> tomorrow<WG839> to the Council,<WG4892> as though<WG5613> they were going<WG3195> to inquire<WG4441> somewhat<WG5100> more<WG199> thoroughly<WG199> about<WG4012> him.

"So<WG3767> do not listen<WG3982> to them, for more<WG4183> than forty<WG5065> of them are lying<WG1748> in wait<WG1748> for him who<WG3748> have bound<WG332> themselves<WG1438> under<WG332> a curse<WG332> not to eat<WG2068> or<WG3383> drink<WG4095> until<WG2193> they slay<WG337> him; and now<WG3568> they are ready<WG2092> and waiting<WG4327> for the promise<WG1860> from you."

Therefore<WG3767> the commander<WG5506> let<WG630> the young<WG3495> man<WG3495> go,<WG630> instructing<WG3853> him, "Tell<WG1583> no<WG3367> one<WG3367> that you have notified<WG1718> me of these<WG3778> things.<WG3778>"

And he called<WG4341> to him two<WG1417> of the centurions,<WG1543> and said,<WG3004> "Get<WG2090> two<WG1250> hundred<WG1250> soldiers<WG4757> ready<WG2090> by the third<WG5154> hour<WG5610> of the night<WG3571> to proceed<WG4198> to Caesarea,<WG2542> with seventy<WG1440> horsemen<WG2460> and two<WG1250> hundred<WG1250> spearmen.<WG1187>"
[They were] also<WG5037> to provide<WG3936> mounts<WG2934> to put<WG1913> Paul<WG3972> on and bring<WG1295> him safely<WG1295> to Felix<WG5344> the governor.<WG2232>
And he wrote<WG1125> a letter<WG1992> having<WG2192> this<WG3778> form: <WG5179>
"Claudius<WG2804> Lysias,<WG3079> to the most<WG2903> excellent<WG2903> governor<WG2232> Felix,<WG5344> greetings.<WG5463>

"When this<WG3778> man<WG435> was arrested<WG4815> by the Jews<WG2453> and was about<WG3195> to be slain<WG337> by them, I came<WG2186> upon them with the troops<WG4753> and rescued<WG1807> him, having learned<WG3129> that he was a Roman.<WG4514>
"And wanting<WG1014> to ascertain<WG1921> the charge<WG156> for which<WG3739> they were accusing<WG1458> him, I brought<WG2609> him down<WG2609> to their Council;<WG4892>

"And when I was informed<WG3377> that there would be a plot<WG1917> against<WG1519> the man,<WG435> I sent<WG3992> him to you at once,<WG1824> also<WG2532> instructing<WG3853> his accusers<WG2725> to bring<WG3004> charges<WG3004> against<WG4314> him before<WG1909> you."
So<WG3767> the soldiers,<WG4757> in accordance<WG2596> with their orders,<WG1299> took<WG353> Paul<WG3972> and brought<WG71> him by night<WG3571> to Antipatris.<WG494>
But the next<WG1887> day,<WG1887> leaving<WG1439> the horsemen<WG2460> to go<WG565> on with him, they returned<WG5290> to the barracks.<WG3925>
And when these<WG3748> had come<WG1525> to Caesarea<WG2542> and delivered<WG325> the letter<WG1992> to the governor,<WG2232> they also<WG2532> presented<WG3936> Paul<WG3972> to him.
And when he had read<WG314> it, he asked<WG1905> from what<WG4169> province<WG1885> he was; and when he learned<WG4441> that he was from Cilicia,<WG2791>

he said,<WG5346> "I will give<WG1251> you a hearing<WG1251> after<WG3752> your accusers<WG2725> arrive<WG3854> also,<WG2532>" giving<WG2753> orders<WG2753> for him to be kept<WG5442> in Herod's Praetorium.<WG4232>
